body_html:
@steplee This is because you are using an older API which now doesn't do what you want (very unfortunately, I might add!) What you want is to replace GetMutable<Tensor> with GetMutableTensor(CUDA), and that will fix your problem.

@jerryzh168 Do you know why we don't have a static assert to reject GetMutable<Tensor> from blob? This seems pretty important. Otherwise the default constructor is invoked, which gives us the undefined tensor, which is why everything is "shared".

body:
@steplee This is because you are using an older API which now doesn't do what you want (very unfortunately, I might add!) What you want is to replace `GetMutable<Tensor>` with `GetMutableTensor(CUDA)`, and that will fix your problem.

@jerryzh168 Do you know why we don't have a static assert to reject `GetMutable<Tensor>` from blob? This seems pretty important. Otherwise the default constructor is invoked, which gives us the undefined tensor, which is why everything is "shared".
